Sentencas: Proton-conducting solid oxide fuel cells have the potential ability to simultaneously convert ethane to electrical energy and value-added ethylene with high selectivity and the absence of CO2 emissions.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells

Sentencas: However, their development is impeded by a lack of efficient and stable anode materials.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells

Sentencas: Herein, insitu exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on (La0.6Sr0.4)(0.95)Fe0.8Ni0.1Mo0.1O3-delta (LSFNM) perovskite oxide are realised by controlling A-site deficiency and Mo-doping.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells

Sentencas: The introduction of high-valence molybdenum ions in (La0.6Sr0.4)(0.95)Fe0.8Ni0.1Mo0.1O3-delta (LSFN) not only stabilises its cubic perovskite structure under a reducing atmosphere, but also facilities the exsolution of FeNi nanoparticles from the parent perovskite matrix.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells

Sentencas: The power density of the BaZ(r0.1)Ce(0.7)Y(0.2)O(3-delta) (BZCY) electrolyte-supported single cells with a LSFNM/BZCY/LSCF-SDC configuration reaches 172mW.cm(-2) at 750 degrees C in C2H6; meanwhile, the ethylene yield also reaches approximately 40.5%.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells

Sentencas: The presented results extend the functionality and applicability of proton conducting fuel cells for carrying out efficient hydrocarbon-related electrochemical conversion for producing power and co-production of value-added chemicals.
Titulo: In-situ exsolved FeNi nanoparticles on perovskite matrix anode for co-production of ethylene and power from ethane in proton conducting fuel cells
